poem:
**Kyiv Rekindled**

In the tender hush of morning light,  
the hum of power returns,  
a city's pulse revived  
beneath the ashen sky,  
where shadows once whispered  
in the night.  
Rising from darkness,  
the spirit kindles—  
unbroken amidst  
the storm's embrace,  
each flicker a testament  
to resilience,  
each glow a breath of hope.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Power returns after Kyiv plunged into darkness by ‘massive’ Russian attack on Ukraine energy sector – as it happened 11.59am BST Closing summary We will be closing this blog shortly. Here is an overview of today’s developments: Power has been restored to 270,000 consumers in Kyiv after Russian overnight attacks knocked it out, Ukraine’s energy minister Svitlana Hrynchuk wrote on Facebook on Friday. Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia used over 450 drones and 30". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
